comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Paul Martyn Lincoln (1/1/1870-12/20/1944) ecommons.library.cornell.edu/bitstream/1813/18464/2/Linco... www.ieeeghn.org/wiki/index.php/Paul_Lincoln "Paul M. Lincoln, President [American Institute of Electrical Engineers]1914-1915 -- Westinghouse engineer - joined [Niagara Falls] Cataract Construction 1896 to 1902 as operating superintendent and later as resident electrician . Involved with Power House 1 and transmission to Buffalo. Invented the synchroscope . Returned to Westinghouse and later became Professor-Director in charge of Department of Electrical Engineering at Cornell [1922-1938]." www.ieeeghn.org/wiki/index.php/Early_Electrification_of_B...

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: artolog thanks for the additional info. We'll add his full name to the record.
